meanings.definition: The process of arranging text and images for printing.
meanings.sent1: Typesetting requires careful placement of words and pictures on a page.
meanings.sent2: The typesetting of this book was done with precision and attention to detail.
meanings.sent3: In the world of typesetting, even a small mistake can lead to big printing errors.
meanings.sent4: Her typesetting skills were like a well-orchestrated dance, each element perfectly in place.
meanings.sent5: The art of typesetting brings words to life on the printed page.

meanings.definition: The act of setting type for printing.
meanings.sent1: Typesetting involves selecting and arranging individual letters for printing.
meanings.sent2: His expertise in typesetting made the text clear and easy to read.
meanings.sent3: The typesetting process can be tedious but is essential for quality printing.
meanings.sent4: The typesetting machine hummed softly as it worked its magic on the text.
meanings.sent5: With precise typesetting, the words on the page become a visual delight.

meanings.definition: The practice of designing and arranging text for publication.
meanings.sent1: Good typesetting enhances the readability and aesthetics of a publication.
meanings.sent2: The magazine's typesetting was modern and appealing to the eye.
meanings.sent3: She approached typesetting like an artist, creating beautiful layouts.
meanings.sent4: The typesetting software allowed for quick and efficient design work.
meanings.sent5: Typesetting is the key to making text look professional and polished.
